35232142: Repair work is ongoing in several areas of Scotland after severe flooding, with calls for more preventative measures and flood protection plans.
40143035: A fire at a hotel in Northern Ireland destroyed two tour buses, forcing German, Chinese, and Taiwanese tourists to delay their trip as police investigate the suspected arson attack.
35951548: Mercedes outpaced Ferrari in Bahrain Grand Prix qualifying, with Lewis Hamilton securing pole position and Sebastian Vettel starting third.
36266422: John Edward Bates faces 22 charges, including indecency with a child, denying all allegations of sexual abuse made by four male complainants during his time as a scout leader.
38826984: Patients and staff were evacuated from Cerahpasa hospital in Istanbul after a man receiving treatment threatened to shoot himself and others, but earlier reports of hostages were incorrect.
34540833: Simone Favaro scored the winning try for Glasgow Warriors in a match against the Dragons, with Glasgow showing superior depth and control.
20836172: Veronica Vanessa Chango-Alverez, 31, was killed in a hit-and-run in Streatham, London, and police are searching for the driver of the Audi involved in the crash.
35932467: Belgian cyclist Demoitie died after a collision with a motorbike during a race, sparking concerns about safety in road racing.
40758845: Manchester City midfielder Ilkay Gundogan is optimistic about his recovery from injury and eager to return to the field, expressing confidence in his team's prospects for the upcoming season.
30358490: A man in his 20s was airlifted to the hospital after a crash at the junction of the A127 and Progress Road in Leigh-on-Sea, Essex.
34615665: Hurricane Patricia is the strongest storm to hit mainland Mexico since 1959, prompting questions about how storm categories are determined.
35890902: Weaknesses in the way wireless mice communicate with computers leave them vulnerable to attackers who can spoof signals and take control of the machines.
37922330: 38 staff at Galashiels-based Murray and Burrell face redundancies as the company goes into administration due to adverse trading conditions, with hopes for some to find jobs at another firm.
30844962: The European Commission has raised concerns about Luxembourg's tax deal with Amazon, suspecting it may constitute illegal state aid.
36217333: The Balmoral Show celebrates agricultural life with food, livestock showcases, and family fun, featuring an "edible garden" and live coverage on social media.
30816523: Max Mosley is suing Google to block photos of him at a sex party, arguing breaches of the Data Protection Act and misuse of private information.
38900884: Dragons player Ed Jackson's injury is a big blow, but it presents an opportunity for other players to step up.
13890581: The Cornish Language Partnership receives three-year funding package to ensure language survival, with long-term support expected from Cornwall.
40194700: Monaco's coach Leonardo Jardim has decided to stay with the club despite receiving offers from elsewhere, citing his strong connection to the team and the principality.
37903647: The State Department criticized Nicaragua's election process as flawed and not free and fair, with Daniel Ortega winning by a large margin amidst opposition allegations of voter abstention.
13291223: South African authorities have announced a task team to address the issue of "corrective rape" targeting lesbians, following global activism and the recent killing of activist Noxolo Nogwaza.
36052570: Big oil producing nations meet in Qatar to discuss production freeze, but doubts remain about its impact on oversupply; US stocks fall on energy sector concerns and weak economic report.
34944735: The blue color in tarantulas is caused by tiny structures in their hairs, suggesting it serves a visual signaling function, possibly for prey concealment or predator warning.
32159602: Andreas Lubitz's internet searches on suicide and cockpit security were found, supporting the conclusion that he intentionally crashed Germanwings Flight 9525, killing all 150 people on board.
34988915: DJ Neil Fox denies multiple counts of indecent assault and sexual assault, claiming all behavior was consensual and part of workplace "horseplay."
37889203: Spurs' manager Pochettino confirmed that midfielder Dele Alli will be sidelined for "a few weeks" due to a knee injury sustained in training.
33609927: The Jehovah's Witnesses' explicit policy of dealing with abuse in-house and reluctance to cooperate with authorities has led to prolonged suffering for victims.
33578778: Yanis Varoufakis criticizes Greece's bailout program as a failure, while the German parliament approves negotiations for an €86bn bailout in exchange for austerity measures.
36888270: The International Paralympic Committee opened proceedings against the National Paralympic Committee of Russia for alleged doping, with a decision on any ban expected in early August.
36846007: Ben Ransom, a 24-year-old rugby player, has signed with the London Irish team, bringing valuable Championship experience to the squad.
31723471: Manor Marussia F1 team has secured investment from Ovo boss Stephen Fitzpatrick and appointed Justin King as interim chairman, aiming to be competitive in the upcoming season.
15921828: The Welsh government agreed on a £39m stimulus package as part of the budget deal, but opposition parties criticized it as inadequate.
39109408: Former UK Prime Minister Sir John Major criticizes the government's approach to Brexit negotiations and warns of the substantial costs of leaving the EU.
20936833: The House of Commons is debating a bill to cap benefit rises at 1% for three years, sparking a political debate over who should bear the financial burden.
36832879: Engineers are working to repair a collapsed sewer under the tracks in Forest Hill, causing disruptions to train services in London.
14958201: Manchester City defeated Everton 2-0 with goals from Mario Balotelli and James Milner, showcasing their patience and persistence in the face of Everton's defensive tactics.
34352262: Nicola Sturgeon claimed to have met a target to reduce six-week delays in discharging patients, but Labour criticized her for not meeting the target for over three years.
39805395: The European Court of Justice ruled that overflow pipes at the Burry Inlet in Wales broke clean water laws, leading to a £113m investment in improvements.
34303109: Pope Francis arrives in Cuba, praising improved US-Cuba relations and urging support for Cuban Catholics, before heading to the US.
39939090: Rangi Chase joins Widnes after being dropped from Castleford's plans, aiming to make an impact for the struggling team.
29347771: Cricket Scotland's chief executive Roddy Smith is stepping down after 10 years, leaving the organization in good health and with growing participation and on-field success.
36783415: Sunderland wants Allardyce to stay as manager despite speculation linking him to the England job, urging the FA to resolve the matter swiftly.
37935687: Wales narrowly defeated Argentina in a rugby match, with Leigh Halfpenny's penalty proving to be the difference in a hard-fought encounter.
40260829: New Zealand's Bulford Kiwi and the Terrain Model of Messines have been designated as scheduled monuments by the Department for Culture, Media and Sport.
36478199: Prison report reveals inmates at HMP Wayland attempted to grab keys from officers, leading to transfer to higher security jail and additional time added to sentences.
34541803: Former Premier League player Chris Sutton believes that Aston Villa manager Tim Sherwood deserves more time to turn the team's fortunes around.
35360841: Transport Minister Edwina Hart aims to streamline the system and reduce fraud in the Welsh transport system following the suspension of tough guidelines introduced in 2013.
35550407: Life expectancy in England varies by region, with concerns about elderly people living in poor health and variations in life expectancy across the country.
37561590: Operation Equinox is investigating hundreds of reported crimes of abuse, with many allegedly committed by council staff on council property between the 1940s and 1990s.
39328843: The Women's FA Cup quarter-final draw has been announced, with Chelsea facing Sunderland, Manchester City playing Bristol City, and Liverpool hosting Notts County.
